By Sulaiman Razvi

Indian Muslims are always questioned about their patriotism even when Indian Muslims sacrificed their lives for India. But Sanghis turns a blind eye all those Hindus arrested for spying for Pakistan. Hope they will storm the streets to condemn Hindu arrested for anti national activities just as they ask Muslims to protest against terrorism 24/7. Recently, 11 Hindus were arrested for spying for Pakistan, one among them was a BJP worker, however this is not the only case where Hindus have been arrested for betraying “Bharat Mata” there have been numerous cases of Hindus leaking sensitive information to Pakistan and other countries and betraying the homeland.

List of Indian officials and spying cases

Manmohan Sharma, a senior Research and Analysis Wing (RAW) officer, was alleged to be in a romantic affair with his Chinese language teacher. Indian authorities suspected the woman could be an informant of the Chinese government and gathered information about India’s moves and counter-moves on the border talks.

In October 2007, a 1975 batch Research and Analysis Service (RAS) officer Ravi Nair was called back from Hong Kong for his ‘friendship’ with a girl believed to be working for a Chinese spy agency.

The most infamous case which shook RAW out of reverie was that of Rabinder Singh who became a mole of American intelligence agency CIA and flew to the US despite being under RAW surveillance.

Ashok Sathe, another official was also believed to have defected to the US after his mysterious disappearance. Sathe was said to be behind burning down of RAW office in Khurramshahr in Iran.

However, in the history of Indian intelligence, the most written about case was that of K V Unnikrishnan, a RAW officer dealing with the LTTE. He had developed a relationship with an air hostess believed to be an intelligence scion. He was arrested just ahead of a peace accord signed between India and Sri Lanka.

item.content:encoded:
by Sulaiman Razvi
Some countries allows Personal Laws. Personal Laws deals with civil matters of a community pertaining to marriage, divorce and inheritance. There have been many debates on implementing Uniform Civil Code in India. Hindus say that they are not governed by any personal law but by secular laws of Indian constitution. Though some Hindu laws are codified such as the Hindu Marriage Act but inheritance law of Hindus called Mitakshara and Dayabhaga law is still followed by Hindus and it has legal backing. So it is inappropriate to say that Hindus do not follow personal law. They have their own form of personal law which is not discussed by any media. In some states like Haryana, Hindus believes in Khap Panchayat which is an assembly of village elders pronouncing punishment even in criminal matters. Though Khap Panchayat has no legal status but they are very influential and has emerged as a judicial body. The Hindu code bill faced severe opposition by Hindus who now claim that they happily accepted it and that they change with time. But that’s not true, the Hindu Code Bill was met with strong opposition from Hindu religious leaders and outfits, in 1949 RSS burned effigies of Dr. B.R. Ambedkar and Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru as a protest against the Hindu Code Bill. The RSS hated Dr. Ambedkar to such an extent and now it is trying to appropriate Dr. Ambedkar to win hearts of Dalits and use them in riots.

Hindus demanding Uniform Civil Code is nothing but a frustration against Muslims. They actually want to enforce their laws on Muslims. Other communities such as Sikhs, Jains and Buddhists are also governed by Hindu Marriage Act, had Muslims also followed Hindu Marriage Act then Hindus would not have raised the issue of implementing Uniform Civil Code. Why Hindus have been so intolerant towards those following their religion? Why Hindus are having problem if Muslims are following their religious laws in civil matters? In the future Hindus may also demand that Muslims must convert to Hinduism. After all I find little difference between enforcing religion and enforcing ones laws on others. How can Hindus demand to implement UCC without presenting a draft bill? Vice Chancellor of NALSAR Mr. Faizan Mustafa also said, “In 1941, a drafting committee comprising 8 members was formed under the chairmanship of (Jurist) B N Rao, that gave its report which was later debated, then a Hindu Code Bill was formed but it was not passed and compromised with Hindu Fundamentalists and diluted. Eventually Law Minister Dr B R Ambedkar had to resign over this. So even after 15 years exercise, government could not make a strong and reform law because daughter could not make copartner. That change government could bring in 2005. Still till today, Hindu laws have not been reformed and there are no uniform Hindu laws…So if government wants to bring reform in Muslim laws. It should make a committee of experts, wait for their report, open it for public debate then make any law.”

Muslims are not demanding something new, Muslims just want to retain the Muslim Personal Law. Muslim Personal Law existed since the British era.
Hindu community is hypocritical. At the time of declaring instant triple talaq as unconstitutional, example of ITT in Muslim countries (including Pakistan) was cited. If that’s the case then would there be reservation for Muslims in India as per the religious proportion as there’s reservation for minorities in Parliamentary as well as assembly seats in Muslim majority countries like Pakistan, Iran, Iraq, Jordan, Lebanon? Hindus are very desperate to implement UCC without a draft bill, but this desperation is absent in case of Uniform criminal code. Though there is no such word but biasedness against minorities in courts can’t be ignored. Innocent Muslims are spending years and decades in jail on false charges whereas Hindu terrorists and rioters are rarely convicted and in case if they are convicted then they are released on bail within couple of days of their conviction like in the case of Alimuddin where the Hindu convicts were granted bail by court, convicts in Mohsin Shaikh’s murder were granted bail by the judge saying ‘in the name of religion, they were provoked and have committed the murder’. Maya Kodnani was earlier convicted by Gujarat court and later acquitted, accused in Akhlaq, Pehlu, Junaid, Qasim, Pansare, Malegaon blast, Kandhamal riot and numerous others were granted bail by court.

Amnesty reported about Muslim women who were raped by Hindus in Muzaffarnagar riot and they are still awaiting justice yet there is not a mention of it by PM but he often comments on triple talaq “victims”, ironically a man comments on triple talaq who abandoned his wife without uttering a single divorce. Oral Instant Triple Talaq constitutes just 0.3% of all divorces among Muslims yet the issue is over stretched and exaggerated by Hindu leaders and media but there is no mention of those Muslim women who suffered at the hands of Hindus, this includes wives, mothers and daughters of Ehsan Jaffry, Akhlaq, Pehlu, Qasim, Alimuddin, Abdul Ghaffur, Zahid Bhat, Hasmat Ali, Mohammed Ayyub, victims in Gujarat, Muzaffarnagar riots, Kunan Poshpora, 8 years old Asifa and numerous others where Muslim women are still awaiting justice and there’s no mention of these incidents even for once by PM. Rather his ministers are busy garlanding and honouring the culprits.

NDPS act prohibits a person to produce/manufacture/cultivate, possess, sell, purchase, transport, store, and/or consume any narcotic drug or psychotropic substance. And Section 294 of Indian Penal Code prohibits a person to roam naked yet Sadhus smokes weed and roams naked. Are they above law? Why they have been exempted from these rules? Why doesn’t Hindutvadis the torch bearers of UCC make them follow Indian Constitution? They say that a secular nation cannot have religious laws, if that’s the case then what is anti-cow slaughter law doing in a secular nation? Anti-cow slaughter law was later added as an amendment. Will Hindus lift ban on communal cow slaughter law if Uniform Civil Code is implemented?

In Goa, only Hindus are allowed Polygamy, not even Muslims can practice polygamy there because of Goa Civil Law. The Hindu men have the right to bigamy under specific circumstances mentioned in Codes of Usages and Customs of Gentile Hindus of Goa (if the wife fails to deliver a child by the age of 25, or if she fails to deliver a male child by the age of 30). For other communities, the law prohibits bigamy. This is not just limited to Goa alone. Though the Hindu Marriage Act prohibits polygamy but Hindus have devised ways to have more than one partner at a time. As discussed in articles Polygamy in Hindu Dharma and Condition of Women in Hindu Society Hindus despite being married are bringing another woman to their house through live-in relationship. Lok Adalat in Madhya Pradesh ordered Basant Mahulal to spend equal time with wife and live-in partner, in Gujarat this practice is legal and is known as Maitri Karar and mostly upper caste Hindu men opt for Maitri Karar, there is also a case of court giving nod to Neha Patani to live with a married man named Sanjay Kumar Patani. In Rajasthan a man named Devdas brought his live-in partner to his house and married her later with his first wife being still alive and living under the same roof. Then what’s the use of prohibiting polygamy for Hindus? Are laws one sided and are they only for Muslims in India? Ironically, Hindus have problem if a woman is brought to the house with reputation of being the wife but they are okay with bringing concubines and mistress to their houses. This is not the only way Hindus practice polygamy, as discussed earlier, Hindus uses another tactic to practice polygamy. Hindus after marrying the second says that their first marriage was not solemnized as some ceremonies pertaining to Hindu law were not duly performed. When a Hindu marries a second wife, the first wife lodges a criminal case against her husband pointing out his polygamy. In many cases the court rejects the case based on meager legal points and eludes the culprit out of punishment.
It’s not just polygamy but even polyandry is practiced by Hindus despite its prohibition. In Parts of Rajasthan and Uttarakkhand there is a custom of Hindu women having several husbands.

Several states like Rajasthan, Haryana, Punjab has cow cess because cow is a sacred animal for Hindus and non-Hindus also has to pay for the upkeep of cow pens. Only Hindus enjoy Hindu Undivided Family (HUF) tax rebate, no other community can have this benefit. Being 80% of the population, only Hindus have got reservation. Reservation to backward classes like SC and ST is justifiable but even upper castes wealthy Hindus are demanding reservation. There was uproar over Hajj subsidy but not even for once did anyone mentioned about thousands of crore rupees that have been given to Hindu pilgrims and festivals like Mansarovar Yatra, Amarnath Yata, Muktinath Yatra, Char Dharm, Kumbh Mela and endowment to temples. Though these are not laws but appeasement of majority and partiality is evident from these things.

On the one hand Hindus wants to implement “secular” Uniform Civil Code and on the other hand they are imposing their beliefs on non-Hindus. Even educational institutions are not spared, Hindus are trying their level best to saffronize educational institutions, Central government run Kendriya Vidyalaya promotes Hinduism through Hindu prayers, BJP minister Vinod Tawde finds no problem in distributing Gita in colleges, BJP wants to make Gita compulsory in schools, BJP in Mumbai, Haryana, Rajasthan have either proposed or made compulsory teaching of Gita, Mahabharata, Veda and Ramayana in schools and colleges, even JNU is set to promote study of Vedas and Upanishads. Have even called for making Sanskrit compulsory in Madhya Pradesh, Assam, Himachal Pradesh. They are also trying to make Yoga compulsory. The reaction of torch bearers of UCC to these won’t be negative rather they will take pride in imposing their beliefs on non-Hindus. That’s their hypocrisy, they don’t want others to follow religious laws in civil matters but Hindus would proudly impose their beliefs on non-Hindus. The issue of separating religion from duty/nation arises only when Muslims demands to sport beard while doing his job as a policeman or working in other government department but they are okay with saffronization of educational institutions and building of illegal temples in court and government office premises.

Huffington Post had published an article stating, ‘These laws have special considerations for Hindus living in different geographical regions, and belonging to different castes and ethnic groups. For example, in some communities in southern India, marriage between an uncle and a niece is allowed and such unions are preferred. On the other hand, such marriages are proscribed and viewed as incestuous by Hindus in north India. How does one apply UCC in such situations?

One could go on. Another example is that of the inheritance laws. Mitakshara & Dayabhaga are the two different types of methods that the Hindu Inheritance Law provides. People can choose either of the two methods to bestow inheritance. However, the Mitakshara Law doesn’t apply in Bengal and Assam. How do you explain the exceptions given to Hindus of Bengal & Assam?

Nagaland, Mizoram and Tribal States of the North East
At one point, Nagas had picked up weapons against India and demanded ‘Naga Sovereignty’. The insurgency went on for years until an agreement was reached that:
“No Act or law passed by the Union Parliament affecting the following provisions shall have legal force in the Nagaland unless specially applied to it by a majority vote of the Nagaland Legislative Assembly.”
(a) The Religious or Social Practices of the Nagas
(b) The Customary Laws and Procedure
(c) Civil and Criminal Justice so far as these concern decision according to the Naga Customary Law.
A similar amendment was introduced for Mizoram as well in 1968, after a long armed struggle with the Indian forces. Subsequently, the Sixth Schedule of the Constitution was enacted to guarantee similar provisions to other North Eastern states such as Meghalaya, Arunachal Pradesh, Manipur, and Tripura. However, Article 44 of the Constitution says that “The State shall endeavor to secure for citizens a uniform civil code throughout the territory of India.” If this article is to be implemented across entire India, this would require these amendments for North Eastern tribal states be removed. Imagine what would be the outcome of such a move?
Ironically, while the torch bearer of UCC call themselves saviours who are carrying the baton of peace, they fail to understand that any attempt to impose UCC will be suicidal as it will incite an armed insurgency across the border states.”

So Hindus follows Mitakshara & Dayabhaga inheritance law, has anti cow slaughter law, has also implemented cow cess in several states, Sadhus roaming naked and smoking weed despite NDPS act and Section 294 of IPC prohibiting it, has special law in Goa, can practice polygamy through live in relationship, even polyandry is prevalent in parts of Rajasthan and Uttarakhand, are imposing their beliefs by making their Hindu scriptures and prayers mandatory in educational institutions, has exclusive tax rebate for Hindu Undivided Family, but still they claim that they do not follow any religious law and abide by secular laws of Indian constitution.

The Myth of Reform in Hindu Society

Hindus claim that they change with time, they have reformed their society, they say that implementation of Hindu code bill has brought great change in the Hindu society. But how true is that? Let’s evaluate how much the Hindu society has progressed.
1) Casteism still prevalent. The National Human Rights Commission Report on the Prevention of Atrocities against Scheduled Castes says that, “every 18 minutes a crime is committed against a Dalit. Every day 3 Dalit women are raped, 2 Dalits are murdered and 2 Dalits Houses are burnt in India, 11 Dalits are beaten. Every week: 13 Dalits are murdered, 5 Dalits home or possessions are burnt, 6 Dalits are kidnapped or abducted.
http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/dalits-untouchable-rohith-vemula-caste-discrimination/1/587100.html

2) 84% of 12 million girls married under the age of 10 are Hindus.
http://www.newindianexpress.com/nation/2016/jun/01/84-percent-of-12-million-married-children-under-10-are-Hindus-935507.html

3) 71% of those married in Uttar Pradesh are minor girls.
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/lucknow/71-of-those-married-in-up-are-minor-girls/articleshow/56695717.cms

4) Hindu community is the least educated religious group in the world as per PEW Research center.
https://www.hindustantimes.com/world-news/hindus-least-educated-religious-group-in-world-says-survey/story-7tNNhrRn958MlSXZdTPzjM.html

5) Devadasi system still exists, says report by one man commission Justice Raghunath Rao according to whom Andhra Pradesh and Telangana together have about 80,000 Devadasi women
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/Devadasi-system-still-exists-in-Telangana-AP-says-report/articleshow/46337859.cms

6) Female foeticide is rampant, 21 Million ‘Unwanted’ Girls, 63 Million ‘Missing’ Women, Says Economic Survey. Gender ratio declined in the Hindu community.
http://www.news18.com/news/india/condition-of-women-improving-but-india-doesnt-want-many-of-them-to-be-born-notes-economic-survey-1644939.html

7) In an informal study of dowry deaths which reached the Supreme Court and the Bombay High Court, conducted by Majlis, Mumbai, over 95 per cent of these cases of dowry death were among Hindus.
http://www.boomlive.in/what-has-hindu-law-ever-done-for-women/

8) Bride selling is prevalent in Haryana and Rajasthan, The study conducted in Haryana’s Jind and Kurukshetra districts, which are most notorious for female foeticide, reveals that 66 per cent of the families practising bride trafficking are Jats, followed by 15 per cent Sainis, though the custom is prevalent among almost all other castes.
http://www.thehindu.com/news/national/other-states/bonded-brides/article4307384.ece

9) It was only in 2014 that the National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB) started collecting data on human sacrifice. The statistics with the bureau reveal a disturbing picture: there were 51 cases of human sacrifice spread across 14 states between 2014 and 2016.
https://www.thequint.com/news/india/goddess-kali-worship-does-not-need-human-sacrifice
And the Sadhus practicing cannibalism.

10) Women are humiliated in Manglik practice which is still prevalent, if the bride is Manglik, she is made to first marry a Peepal tree or a dog. It is believed that marrying a Manglik woman results in the early death of the husband. Hence, the woman is first married to a tree or an animal to ward off the evil effects of the curse on her human husband.
https://www.indiatimes.com/culture/who-we-are/10-sexist-indian-marriage-customs-that-need-to-be-banned-233045.html

11) There are 5000-10000 widows living like beggars in Mathura and Vrindavan.
https://www.hindustantimes.com/india-news/you-do-not-care-about-the-widows-of-india-supreme-court-tells-government/story-IkB1MDQ7wspcPxyaA6iw5J.html

12) Hindus are less likely to use a toilet than Muslims in India.
https://theprint.in/governance/hindus-are-less-likely-to-use-a-toilet-than-muslims-in-india/44959/

13) Hindus are more polygamous than Muslims despite Hindu Marriage Act prohibiting it. And have also invented ways like live-in relationship, Maitri Karar to have more than one partner at a time.
https://scroll.in/article/669083/muslim-women-and-the-surprising-facts-about-polygamy-in-india
https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/Bigamy-An-issue-of-one-too-many/articleshow/5004493.cms

14) There are 20 lakh abandoned Hindu wives in India.
https://thewire.in/gender/abandoned-women-triple-talaq
So just by bringing a law Hindus cannot claim that their society is reformed. Had their society really being reformed then these evils wouldn’t have existed even after implementation of Hindu Code Bill some 6 decades ago. It suggests that Hindus are still stuck in with their outdated practices and rituals, they have not moved away from these practices and rituals. I have mentioned only few of the evils that exists in their societies. For more information read the article, Condition of Women in Hindu Society.

item.content:encoded:
By Sulaiman Razvi

Building temple is an easy task in India. First you either paint existing stone or place idol of Hindu god at any place more specifically below a tree. No one will object to it, then expand it gradually and construct a huge temple there. If authorities tries to demolish it then Hindus will stage a protest and authorities will go away with temple being untouched. This is how several temples are built in India. This is the reason you will find small temples in every corner of the street. But this tactic is not just limited to roads, footpaths or public places, Hindus have attempted to usurp mosques and Muslim monuments as well. They places an idol near the mosque or Muslim monument and expands it if Muslims objects to it then they will use their power to silence Muslims. Charminar of Hyderabad is one such example where an illegal temple called Bhagyalaxmi Mandir was built illegally just by placing a small stone in 1960s or 1980s.

Image source:
https://www.thehindu.com/news/national/andhra-pradesh/As-protests-roil-Charminar-Hyderabad%E2%80%99s-heritage-slowly-vanishes/article12059217.ece

Archaeological Survey of India also states that the temple was built illegally,

Image source: https://hyderabad.mapunity.com/heritage/galleries

The other image is taken from a Twitter handle

ASI takes up temple issue

ASI Superintending Archaeologist of Hyderabad Circle Milan Kumar Chauley said that part of the temple has encroached into the south-east minaret of the Charminar.

The official presented his case with the aid of several photographs from 1950s to date which show that the temple came on the southern-east end of the monument much later.

The ASI has time and again said that the temple is an encroachment on the monument.

Hindu community is an endangered species in India, the government must leave tigers and save Hindus first as only 1 billion Hindus are left in India. ‘Hindu Khatre Mein Hain’ is often said by right-wing Hindus to portray that Hindus are the victim in India, this imaginary fear is created with a purpose to consolidate Hindus. Fear-mongering is a tool they use to mobilize Hindus and to instigate them against Muslims. This article has two parts, the first part is about Hindu’s imaginary victimhood and the second part is “Against Indian Culture.” I have not included many cases as they can be found in How Peaceful Are Hindus article.

item.content:encoded:
Written by Sulaiman Razvi

India is a Secular, Republic, Democratic country. The 42nd Amendment of the Constitution of India enacted in 1976, the Preamble to the Constitution asserted that India is a secular nation. India was divided in 1947 on religious ground with Pakistan declaring itself as Islamic Republic. But has India maintained its Secularism? The answer is no! Right-wing parties in India have made mockery of the constitution by making India an undeclared Hindu Rashtra (state). India has reduced to a majoritarian state where minorities live at the mercy of Hindus but protected by the constitution. Pakistan should have learned from right wing parties of India on how to pretend to be secular. Dr. B.R. Ambedkar had long ago warned about the fanatical Hindutva which India is now witnessing, Dr Ambedkar wrote, “If Hindu Raj does become a fact, it will, no doubt, be the greatest calamity for this country. No matter what the Hindus say. Hinduism is a menace to liberty, equality and fraternity. On that account it is incompatible with democracy. Hindu Raj must be prevented at any cost.”

Hindus claim that it were Muslims who first demanded a separate country for them (Muslims) but the fact is that it was Vinayak Damodar Savarkar who first proposed the two nation theory which was also supported by other Hindus like Dr. Moonje, Pandit Madan Mohan Malviya, Lala Lajpat Rai, Bhai Parmanand, Swami Shraddhanand and Bankimchandra Chattopadhyay and this was later adopted by Muhammad Ali Jinnah. Vinayak Damodar Savarkar wanted India to become a Hindu country, the Hindu Mahasabha identified India as a Hindu country. Even if Hindu nationalists refuse to admit the fact that Savarkar didn’t propose two nation theory, they can never deny the fact that Savarkar had supported Jinnah on the two nation theory. Mohammed Ali Jinnah and Vinayak Damodar Savarkar had conflicting ideologies but Savarkar expressed strong support for Jinnah as far as the two nation theory was concerned. The Hindu nationalist BJP idolises such a person like Savarkar who talked about dividing India.

Hindus claim that India is secular because Hindus are majority. But I beg to differ, India is secular not because of the majority but because of sane minded secularists like Mahatma Gandhi, Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru, Dr. B.R. Ambedkar. Right wing Hindus are being hypocritical when they claim that India is secular because of Hindu majority considering the fact that right wing Hindus are trying their level best to turn India into a Hindu state (and are achieving it), right wing parties winning every election with a huge mandate disapproves their claim that Hindus are secular. Deendayal Upadhyaya who is revered by the BJP had said, “By declaring Bharat as a secular nation, the soul of Bharat has been attacked. A secular state is full of woes [sic]. Although Ravana’s dharmaless state of Lanka had plenty of gold, it had no Rama Rajya (state) in it.” Nathuram Godse had written a letter to Savarkar on February 28, 1938 stating that, “Sir, your goal is the achievement of the Hindu Rashtra. There are 50,000 disciplined RSS cadres who carry the same aspiration in their hearts...” He had also said, “Manusmriti is that scripture which is most worshippable after Vedas for our Hindu nation…” K.B. Hedgewar founder of RSS delivered a speech saying: ‘I see before my eyes today a miniature Hindu Rashtra’. Savarkar came up with two nation theory in 1923 that is 16 years before the Muslim League adopted it, In May 1947, Shyama Prasad Mukherjee wrote a letter to Lord Mountbatten telling him that Bengal must be partitioned even if India was not. The Hindu Mahasabha leader Lala Lajpat Rai wrote in The Tribune of December 14, 1924: “Under my scheme the Muslims will have four Muslim States: (1) The Pathan Province or the North-West Frontier; (2) Western Punjab (3) Sindh and (4) Eastern Bengal. If there are compact Muslim communities in any other part of India, sufficiently large to form a province, they should be similarly constituted. But it should be distinctly understood that this is not a united India. It means a clear partition of India into a Muslim India and a non-Mulsim India.” Bal Gangadhar Tilak said, “had it not been for the influence of caste, the Hindu nation would have long ceased to exist’…’Caste alone is the basis of a Hindu nation”. Tilak called upon his supporters “to capture the institutions like the Poona Sarvajanik Sabha and the Congress” to facilitate ‘the regeneration of the Hindu nation’. A secularist named Ranade opposed this statement of Tilak to which Tilak responded as “unnational tendency that strike[s] a deathblow at the very fabric which has interwoven us into the Hindu nation”.

Veteran BJP leader L.K. Advani asserted that India should be a Hindu Rashtra as reported by Indian Express in 1993 although he backtracked from his statement later in order to avoid consequences, another BJP leader Govindacharya said that, “A nation should be more than just a railway platform. Only a Hindu Rashtra can bring a sense of belonging.” RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat had called India as a Hindu Rashtra in a congregation at the Khanapara Veterinary College field in Assam and at another event he called for making India a Hindu Rashtra. Yogi Adityanath said at a rally in 2009, “I will not stop till I turn UP and India into a Hindu rashtra.” And when asked about Hindu Rashtra Yogi Adityanath said that there is nothing wrong with Hindu Rashtra concept. Tathagata Roy who is former RSS-BJP insider and currently serving as Governor of Meghalaya called for changing of constitution and hinting at making India a Hindu Rashtra, in a tweet he also said that a democratic Hindu Rashtra is possible. BJP MLA Surendra Singh said, “Only those Muslims will stay in India who assimilate into Hindu culture, India will become Hindu Rashtra by 2024.” 150 Hindu outfits held a meeting in Goa to discuss possibilities of Hindu Rashtra. BJP MP from Bangalore South constituency Tejasvi Surya said in a tweet, “I am all the more convinced that we must unapologetically agitate for a Hindu rashtra…” Another BJP MP Anant Kumar Hegde proudly boasted about his “party’s vision & dedication for Hindutva, HinduRasthra…” in a tweet. BJP MLA Raja Singh from Telangana says, “We have a determination/commitment towards Hindu rashtra, for this Hindu rashtra, we need an army. How can this army be formed? All over India, we are forming an army for Hindu rashtra, the protection of dharma and the nation. For this, there’s a ten day camp for which we have come to Bengaluru.” RSS leader Prachar Pramukh Manmohan Vaidya said that Secularism is irrelevant to India and also said that Saffron should have been the only colour of Indian flag. BJP MP Ravi Kishan said that India is a Hindu Rashtra. BJP MP from Telangana Arvind threatened Siddipet police commisioner (who happens to be a practicing Christian) by saying that “this is a Hindu rashtram (Hindu country) remember that”. BJP leader Ashwini Upadhyay, who had been arrested in August in connection with an event where inflammatory slogans calling for violence against Muslims were shouted at a rally in Delhi’s Jantar Mantar, was also present in Haridwar. He presented a “bhagwa samvidhaan” or a saffron constitution at the event. Hindu religious leader Anand Swaroop, head of a body named the Shankaracharya Parishad, said the “demand (for Hindu Rashtra) raised by the Hindu Mahasabha in 1915 is relevant even today and every democratically elected government in Delhi, Uttarakhand, Uttar Pradesh and other states will have to abide by the final resolution of the Dharma Sansad…If not, they will have to face opposition stronger than the 1857 war of Independence.” No action was taken against these Hindu politicians for making unconstitutional remarks. Imagine a Muslim politician saying he would turn India into an Islamic country. Election Commission of India would’ve imposed a lifetime ban on him from contesting elections, the Muslim politician would’ve been sentenced to lifetime imprisonment. Hindus complain that Muslims and Christians have several countries while Hindus don’t have any country with Hinduism as the state religion, would Hindus support formation of Khalistan since Sikhs also don’t have a country of theirs? What would happen if a Sikh politician calls any region of India as Khalistan? India is a secular country (by constitution) and making demand to turn it into a religious state is against the constitution. So it is incorrect to say that India is secular due to Hindu majority since the right wing Hindus who forms the majority of Hindu community has always dreamt about establishing a Hindu Rashtra (state).

It’s not just politicians even Meghalaya High Court Judge S.R. Sen said that “India should have been a Hindu country.” The Reason I have clubbed topics Hindu Rashtra & Hindu appeasement together is because these two goes hand in hand. I have also added many points from my previous articles, though I don’t like to repeat same points again and again but those points are so important you can’t just give them a miss. India is a secular country but yet only three castes can be President’s bodyguard, they are Jats, Rajputs and Sikhs and this was also defended by the Indian Army saying there’s no caste bias. In Banaras Hindu University, The entry of Sikhs, Jains and Buddhists is allowed, but other non-Hindus are prohibited from entering the Sanskrit department. Sanskrit is the second official language in Himachal Pradesh and Uttarakhand states of India. Government is promoting Hinduism and has uploaded various Hindu scriptures in their websites. Indian stock market (both NSE & BSE) has a fixed timing between 9:00 A.M to 3:30 P.M but stock market opens specifically during Muhurat Trading at around 6:00 P.M irrespective of whether there’s a holiday on this occasion which is deemed auspicious among Hindus. Government gives bonus to central government employees during Diwali, although bonus is given to all employees irrespective of their religion but a government giving bonus on festival of particular religion is not part of Secularism. If you are a politician and if you seek votes in the name of religion then the Election Commission of India would put a ban on you, even mosques, churches cannot urge its adherents to vote for particular candidate, but according to Indian law, one can seek votes in the name of Hindutva as Hinduism is not a religion but a way of life. Ironically this definition isn’t applied when giving citizensip to non-Muslims or when giving tax rebate. Assam Chief Minister from BJP Hemanta Biswa specifically appealed to the Muslim immigrants to adopt family planning. Two Child norm has been implemented in Assam and people with more than 2 children will not be able to avail some government benefits, but this law is not applicable to some Hindu classes such as SC, ST and the Tea tribe. He says he want upliftment Muslims from poverty by implementing the two child policy norm. The defense minister of India Rajnath Singh flew to France to do Shastra Puja on receiving the first Rafale jet. There is discrimination on Visa rules. Muslims from Pakistan, Bangladesh and Afghanistan overstaying in India will have to pay penalty 200 times higher than non-Muslims from these same countries. The penalty is much less for Hindus from these countries,  “This means if Liton Das (a Bangladeshi cricketer, a Hindu) overstays for a day, then he will have to pay ₹100, whereas if the person’s name is Saif Hasan, he will have to pay over ₹21,000, which is what Mr. Hasan paid,” a senior Bangladeshi official told The Hindu. Uttar Pradesh state passed “Love Jihad” law, according to the BJP government this outlaws unlawful conversion through marriage. The law is based on the myth that Muslim men lures Hindu girls into marrying them and converting them to Islam. Like other laws, this too is going to be misused against Muslims. In less than a month after the Love Jihad law was passed, 30 Muslim men were arrested by police for marrying Hindu women. In Moradabad’s Kanth area, a Muslim man was stopped by Bajrang Dal from marrying a Hindu woman, despite consensual marriage the Muslim man and his brother were arrested by police under the Love Jihad law. In Bareilly’s Hafizganj area, police helped two Muslim women who converted to Hinduism for marrying Hindu men, despite the woman’s family lodging complaint against the Hindu man for converting their daughter, the police instead called the two families and settled the dispute. In Kushinagar, police stopped Muslim marriage and took the bride and groom in custody overnight and tortured the groom Haider Ali and let the couple go only after the bride proved that she is a Muslim by birth and not by conversion. A Muslim teen in Bijnor returning from a birthday party was beaten up by Hindu mob for walking with his Hindu friend and was later arrested by police with charges under sections of the SC/ST Act, and the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act, police allegedly filed a fake FIR against the Muslim teen which was later exposed by the girl’s father. As per National Herald India’s report, UP Police registered six cases where Hindu women were allegedly lured into ‘forcible’ marriages or deceived, but it ignored similar cases where Muslim women were involved. Police arrested Muslim youth Owais Ahmed under Love Jihad law after pressurizing the Hindu girl’s father to file a case against the Muslim youth in a Bareilly village. Several villagers including the pradhan Dhruv Raj suspect police pressure behind the case as the dispute was settled a year ago.

In UP’s Mushara village of Sant Kabir Nagar district, Muslims are not allowed to celebrate Eid ul Azha (Bakrid), the police of secular India confiscates all animals fit for sacrifice and returns them to Muslims three days after the Eid is finished. Do you really think police and administration are so helpless in front of Hindu fanatics? Mumbai High Court banned slaughter of animals in houses and public places and said that animal sacrifice must be performed only in slaughter houses, and it is given in the view to maintain hygeine. Muslims in Shivala Kala village of Noorpur town in Bijnor district did not witness Bakrid celebrations and neither offered Namaz after local administration denied slaughter of buffaloes and camels stating that it is a “New tradition”. The same reason of “new tradition” was also cited to deny permission to Muslims in Bareilly to mark the Urs of scholar Mufti Akhtar Raza Khan after complaints by Hindutva outfits like Shiv Sena and Hindu Yuva Vahini. There are also several instances where Muslims were barred from worshipping in their mosques, or to reconstruct mosques, or from praying on open plot with prior permission from landlord 1, 2, 3, 4. And then these Hindus object when Muslims pray on road in front of mosques for 10 minutes. An Imam in Gurugram’s Basai was detained by police for holding prayer on open plot with prior permission from owner of the land.

Haridwar priests forced RSS’s Muslim arm to shift meet venue. According to sources, local priests pointed to MRM office-bearers a colonial-era provision in the Haridwar nagar palika bylaws (Haridwar until a few years ago was a municipality) which said that “no religious or social activities by non-Hindus would be permitted within the town’s municipal limits“. Only Hindus are allowed to trade near temples as per a law in Karnataka, Karnataka Hindu Religious Institutions and Charitable Endowments Rules, 2002, restricted the auction of temporary stalls only to the Hindu community during the annual festivals (jatres) at Hindu temples in the State. The 2002 rules clearly state that shops, buildings, and vacant sites located near temples should not be auctioned to non-Hindus. “There is no compromise in implementing the rules,” the Minister said. There’s a Hindu only village namely Kesalingayapalli located 35 km from Kadapa District in Andhra Pradesh where 250 Hindu families has warned non-Hindus from entering the village. Several temples in India bar entry of non-Hindus which is a violation of secular nature of the Indian constitution. Hindus gives advertisement for renting or selling of the house and clearly mentions that no Muslim would be allowed and that it is only for Hindus. And the authority turns blind eye to this discrimination in secular India. There were reports of Uttar Pradesh’s Mathura police uniform getting the logo with an image of Hindu god Krishna. Even the police force is not free from forced religiousness.

India is a secular state and the right wing opposes anything related to Muslims even if it is a language like Urdu but they are okay with mixing politics with religion. It doesn’t behove a secular country to promote religion especially the majority religion through emblems and statues. The State Emblem of Bihar has Hindu symbol Swastika, the state emblem of Tamil Nadu has Srivilliputur Andal Temple, The State Emblem of Karnataka is Gandaberunda, which is a form of Hindu god Vishnu. Whereas the Muslim majority Indonesia also has emblem of another Hindu god named Garuda. So whether Hindus are minority or majority they always like to enforce their religion and mix politics with religion, it’s like heads I win, tails you lose. The BJP government issued several new currency notes which has pictures of Hindu temples, such as the Konark Temple, Stone Chariot of Hampi. Indonesia a Muslim majority country had picture of Hindu god Ganesh on its currency whereas Hindu leaders would be irked just by roads named after Muslim figures. In the premises of Rajasthan High Court there’s an idol of Manu, who was a Hindu God/Rishi the writer of Manu Smriti. You would find statues of Hindu scholar Swami Vivekananda on main roads and his portraits in government offices, what was his contribution to India? He was just a Hindu religious scholar and his contribution was for his religion only. Uttar Pradesh’s Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath announced that statues of Hindu goddess Saraswati and Hindu sage Bhardwaj would be installed in Akbar fort. Even Courts and Police Stations are not spared, Hindu temples occupies area in the premises of government offices and walls of offices carry photos of Hindu gods. These things undermine India’s secularism. Ironically when Muslims wants to wear Burkha or sport beard we are told to “keep your religion at home” while Hindus proudly impose their beliefs on others and makes brazen display of their religion in government offices.

In more than fives states of India conversion is regulated through Anti-Conversion law or Freedom of Religion Act, the law is actually aimed at Dalits and Adivasis converting to Islam and Christianity. Those converting to other faiths must get prior permission, an organization cannot carry out conversion in those states whereas Hindu outfits openly conducts Ghar Wapsi programs in those states without facing any action. In Agra a youth named Aadil (formerly Ved Prakash) had embraced Islam after falling in love with a Muslim girl, his parents filed case against him and he was arrested for converting to Islam. In Uttar Pradesh, four Christians were arrested by police for allegedly forced conversion and were later released. The Washington Times reported, “According to Chief Minister Pema Kandhu, the law does the exact opposite of what it was intended to do. Instead of serving as a measure to protect Arunachal Pradesh’s indigenous religious communities from forced or fraudulent conversions, the law has been weaponized to oppress the freedom of religion of other communities. “The law could undermine secularism and is probably targeted towards Christians,” the chief minister said.” In Orissa 12 tribals were arrested for converting to Christianity without an official permit, whereas in another incident ‘Ghar Wapsi‘ was conducted by Hindus to re-convert those who had converted to Christianity in Orissa. VHP in Gujarat re-converted 500 tribal Christians without any permission. There was uproar when a vehicle with flexi banners belonging to Christian missionaries was spotted at Srisailam Hills which is a temple town of Hindus, A priest at the Srisailam temple said there was no permission for members of other religions to propagate their faith on the hills.

I am reproducing some excerpts from Shoaib Danyal’ Scroll.in article, “This religious discrimination isn’t a one-off event. It is, in fact, enshrined in law. Five states across the Indian Union ban conversion in all but name. In Orissa, Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Gujarat and Himachal Pradesh the process of conversion is regulated to such a Kafkaesque degree that it is impossible to carry out – which was precisely the motive of the framers of the law. In September, 2014, for example, the Madhya Pradesh police had arrested four Dalits for converting to Islam. The four men had decided to change their religion driven by the caste system – a move perfectly in consonance with the Universal Declaration of Human Rights and, indeed, common sense. Yet, they broke the law by not taking the permission of the Madhya Pradesh state government… What is a forced conversion? For example, “force” also includes the “threat of divine displeasure”. So, farcically, if a missionary informs a person that only Christians are allowed entry into heaven – a core part of the faith – that could also be construed as “force”. This interpretation of “force” was upheld by the Orissa High Court in Yulitha Hyde v. State of Orissa. It held that the “threat of divine displeasure numbs the mental faculty; more so of an undeveloped mind and the actions of such a person thereafter, are not free and according to conscience”. Even while Christian congregations are attacked by raising the bogey of conversion, the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh boasts openly about conversion of Christians to Hinduism. In Jharkhand, the RSS aims to make whole blocks “Christianity free” and recently converted 53 families to Hinduism.”

There’s food discrimination too, Hindus have been imposing their diet on others. Haryana imposed ban on sale of meat in Thanesar and Pehowa municipality areas. The sale of meat and liquor has been banned in Vrindavan and Barsana which were declared pilgrimage sites by the Yogi Adityanath government on Friday. There were also reports of UP government considering ban on sale of meat in Ayodhya and Mathura. The Gujarat government on August 14, declared Palitana a meat-free zone by banning the sale of meat, fish and eggs along with prohibiting animal slaughter within the town’s limits. Supreme Court upheld ban on eggs, meat or fish in Rishikesh. Public trade in meat, fish and eggs are banned in Haridwar. In 2004, the Supreme Court upheld the Uttarakhand government’s move to make holy towns Haridwar, Rishikesh and Muni Ki Reti free from non-vegetarian food. In Gurugram Hindu outfits forcefully shut down meat shops during Navratri, in one incident over 500 meat shops were shut down by Shiv Sainiks and the government remained a mute spectator indicating that it condones the forceful shut down of meat shops, ironically condom sale spikes during Navratri but only meat shops hurt their sentiments. Meat shops are also shut during Kanwar Yatra and other Hindu festivals. In Delhi, BJP-ruled civic body banned display of non-veg food outside eateries for sentimental reasons saying that it hurts the sentiments of vegetarians. The Karnataka government gave contract to ISKCON’s Akshay Patra to provide Mid-Day meals to children, however ISKCON is not providing eggs, garlic and onion to children citing religious belief saying that it will provide only Satvik diet. item.content:encoded:
As we all know popular Nestle brand Maggi was banned because it contains Monosodium Glutamine and Lead of 17 ppm whereas Lead of up to 0.01 ppm is permissible. Ayurvedic medicines are proved to have heavy lead which is dangerous to human instead of being curing agents.
Evidence proving Ayurvedic medicines contain poisonous Lead metal

http://bcmj.org/bc-centre-disease-control/heavy-metal-poisoning-ayurvedic-medicines
http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3259062/
http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2012/12/13/167207176/lead-poisoning-cases-provide-new-reminder-about-hazards-of-ancient-remedies
http://www.cdc.gov/mmwr/preview/mmwrhtml/mm6133a1.htm?s_cid=mm6133a1_x
http://www.rediff.com/news/report/ayurvedic-medicines-pose-lead-poisoning-risk/20120824.htm
http://scroll.in/article/731849/maggi-controversy-millions-of-indians-face-danger-of-lead-poisoning-%E2%80%92-from-ayurveda
Ayurvedic text explaining to add lead heavy metal to medicine ‘Pushpadhanwa Rasa’.
हरभुजगलय्हं चाभ्रकं वंगचूर्ण कनकविजययष्टी शाल्मली नागवल्ली।
घृतमधुसितदुग्धं पुष्प धन्वा रसेन्द्रो रमयति शतरामा दीर्घमायुर्बलंच॥
harabhujagalayhaṃ cābhrakaṃ vaṃgacūrṇa kanakavijayayaṣṭī śālmalī nāgavallī |
ghṛtamadhusitadugdhaṃ puṣpa dhanvā rasendro ramayati śatarāmā dīrghamāyurbalaṃ ca ||
http://ayurmedinfo.com/2012/07/27/pushpadhanwa-ras-benefits-dosage-ingredients-side-effects/
Some of the common myths, apologist argument justifying Lead metal in Ayurveda
1) Lead in Ayurveda is different or processed and because of that it will not cause harm.
This is completely absurd. Any form of Lead metal is poisonous to body and there is no safe Lead.
2) Ayurveda, Siddha, Unani are practised for 1000 years. If that is the case, how come it is possible to have harmful metal in it?
While it is true that some Ayurvedic-Siddha medicines might have benefits, none of these health benefits have been recorded by systematic study involving multiple field trials and randomized control tests. Did any time Ayurveda-Siddha went thru scrutiny for their effectiveness. If they were effective why was life expectancy of Indians was far less before advent of modern medicine ? Indian union govt should ask its AYUSH (Ayurveda, Yoga, Unani, Siddha, Homoeopathy) department to carry out this independent study before allowing these products in market. Instead these products are blindly sold to vulnerable patients who are already in weak position because of disease.
Just because Homeopathy was invented by a German, people in Germany are not rallying for it or defending it. Every medical school should be evaluated by its merit and ability to cure diseases not by its origins. Innocent peoples life is not a place where one can show his/her patriotism. Doing so will be just chauvinism.

Hindus have no problem giving citizenship to Pakistani Hindu refugees even when several Hindus were caught spying for Pakistan. Coming to the point, India’s foreign minister Sushma Swaraj had clarified that Hindu population in Bangladesh isn’t decreasing but rather it is increasing, she cited Bangladesh Bureau, “About the demographic changes in Bangladesh, as per statistics of the Bangladesh Bureau, in 2011 there were 8.4 percent Hindus in the country, which has risen to 10.7 percent in 2017. The Hindu had also published a report stating that Hindus in Bangladesh were up by 1 percent within a year. Now imagine if the Muslim population in India had increased by 2 percent within 6 years, Hindutvadis would’ve forcefully sterilized Muslim men in India and would’ve butchered a couple of thousand as a measure to control Muslim population. They claim that Hindus were reduced from 20% to 1% in Pakistan while the fact is that Hinduism is the fastest-growing religion in Pakistan. As mentioned in the article The Vanishing Hindus of Pakistan– A demographic study, Hindu population in Pakistan in the year 1951 post migration was 1.3% which was increased to 1.8% in 1998. Hindu population in UAE is 6.6% as per PEW Research which is going to increase to 7.7% by 2020. Actually, Hindu extremists in India have no love for Pakistani and Bangladeshi Hindus, there’s actually a motive behind it when they that Hindu population is decreasing in Pakistan and Bangladesh they don’t actually mean that what they mean is that they command fellow Hindus to “do the same to Muslims in India”. This is how they run their machinery of propaganda against Muslims and shamelessly claim to be tolerant. Not just that, almost 90% of fake news spread by Hindus online is directed at Muslims, and yet they go to Muslim countries for better living while abusing and oppressing Muslims in India. Hindu population in Muslim majority Middle East and North Africa is going to double by the year 2050.
